content:
Apart from infrastructure, there are other challenges that Jhansi needs to address to attract more businesses and industries. Some of the major challenges include:

1. Availability of skilled labor: Though Jhansi has technical and vocational institutes, there is still a shortage of skilled workers in certain industries. The city needs to address this issue by providing more training programs and skill development opportunities to the youth.

2. Lack of investment in research and development: Jhansi needs to focus on investing in research and development to promote innovation and attract businesses that require advanced technology.

3. Limited access to finance: Jhansi needs to create more access to financing options for businesses to help them invest in technology, equipment and inventory to remain competitive.

4. Adapting to changing global markets: Businesses today need to be constantly adapting to changing global markets in order to stay competitive. Jhansi needs to attract businesses that are adaptable and have a forward-thinking approach to innovation and growth.

5. Better connectivity: Jhansi is located in a landlocked area, making connectivity a challenge. The city needs to improve transportation infrastructure, such as air connectivity, to make it easier for businesses to access the city and export their products.

If Jhansi can address these challenges and provide a supportive business environment, it will be able to attract more businesses and industries, contributing to its economic growth and development.
